Articles.Content:
I was wondering, with upgradeable buildings planned for 0.90, what might happen when the player upgrades their tracking station? I thought we could all share some ideas. I have jotted down some but I would like to hear yours.

Increased asteroid detection radius
:

Would be a way to expand upon ARM. But it might make near Kerbin asteroids spawn less often, which might not be bad in the late game. Perhaps something like
Custom Asteroids
.

Planet Discovery
:

Discover new planets and moons with the tracking station. Better tracking station = more distant planets to discover.

A reason to add more planets/moons

Would be fun for new players, but for experienced players (that have already seen all the planets) it might not be very interesting.

Procedural planets? But that's a whole new can of worms.

There are other ways to do this besides the tracking station (like telescopes).

Communications
:

Limit how far away from Kerbin the player can transmit data. But this limits the player without giving them anything interesting in return.

Something like
RemoteTech
could use an upgradeable tracking station.

Resources
:

In
HarvesteR's most recent dev blog
, Collecting resources is mentioned as something the devs would like to add to the game. Perhaps an upgrading your tracking station could...

give a preview for the amount and/or type of resources on different plantes/asteroids. This depends on how Squad decides to implement the feature of course.

Better tracking station = closer estimates/further scan range?

These aren't necessarily good ideas or even what I would like to see in the game, I just tried to think of some possibilities.

Edited October 17, 2014 by xub313

Your choice of communications device could affect your communications range, and not for control but only for transmitting science. Once you get past the range of your comms device, you get a reduced science return, diminishing further with distance from the KSC. An upgraded tracking station might have a larger detection dish thus allowing it to receive communications from greater distances.

The antenna (Communotron 16) might be fine out past the Mun and start to diminish a bit before Minmus, with complete range upgrades allowing the antenna to work perfectly out to the edge of the Kerbin system.

The Comms DTS-M1 might give perfect communications as far as Duna or Eve as long as they are on the closer parts of their orbit relative to Kerbin. Fully upgrading the Tracking Station range could improve its perfect range up to allow communication with Duna and Eve across much larger portions of their orbit, and even allow undiminished communications out as far as the Sun, or Dres on close approach.

The big dish (Communotron 8T-88) might give perfect communications out a bit past Jool, and upgrading the range on the Tracking Station could be beneficial for this device once more distant planets are released. On the most distant planets, it would be impossible to get a perfect data relay just because of sheer distance.

this reminds me of something I was thinking just the other day...

...basically the same principle but you start the career without having anything visible in the tracking station other than what is actually visible from the ground e.g. the mun when it is overhead at the KSC, kerbol when it is daytime at the KSC etc etc.

When the mun or kerbol is 'visible' you can use a small amount of science to research the 'track' of these objects and then it appears permanently in the tracking station.

Then you could research observatory parts, telescope parts or upgrade the tracking station disk to scan the sky for other objects. Once these parts are in action (either as land based vehicles or orbiting observatories) and you have detected a given object you can then research its track and add it permanently to the tracking station.

I havn't put too much in depth thought to it though...
